title: Pop quiz...
content:
I thought some of you might enjoy this test I’ve created. It’s not exactly typography-based besides the fact that each question has an answer that is one single character (letter, number, punctuation). Though some typographic knowledge _would_ help.

If you take it, please post how far you get, I’d like to know if any of the questions are impossibly unfair.

Take the [The Tough Characters Test](http://web.archive.org/web/20091129143927/http:/www.philatype.com/).
author: koleslaw

comments.content: I thought “A” was the first letter of the latin alphabet, but the quiz just flashes orange at me. apparently that implies that I’m wrong. hmmm.

Right...It’s meant to be tricky.

Hint: It’s not asking for the first letter of the latin alphabet. It’s asking for the first letter in Latin Alphabet.

I got to :/2, tried with a manual brute force attack (tried IPA symbols too), but nothing worked. (And no, solution is not the half of colon, the period.) Or maybe it’s just too late here…
The first letter in “Latin Alphabet” is ’L’.

_The first letter in “Latin Alphabet” is ’L’._
